text: Yrick Gallantes (born 14 January 2001) is a Filipino professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for the Azkals Development Team, on loan from Hibernian, and the Philippines national team. ==Career== Galantes was born in the Philippines, but was raised in Scotland after his family emigrated there. He started his football career in the Hibernian academy. He first played for the club's development squad in October 2016, aged 15. In July 2019, Galantes was sent out on loan to Lowland Football League club Gala Fairydean Rovers. Gallantes was then loaned to the Azkals Development Team in October 2020. ==International career== He is currently available to represent both the Philippines and Scotland. ===Philippines U-22=== Gallantes was part of the Philippines U-22 Olympic squad that competed in the 2019 Southeast Asian Games held in Philippines. ===Philippines=== In March 2019, Galantes received an invitation to train with the Philippines national team. He was called up for the Philippines squad in August 2019, ahead of the 2022 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Syria and Guam. He made his debut for the Philippines in a 4–1 win against Guam on 10 September. He was part of the starting eleven of that match but was substituted out on the 36th minute for Javier Patino. ==References== ==External links== * * * Category:2001 births Category:Living people Category:Filipino footballers Category:Philippines international footballers Category:Scottish footballers Category:Association football midfielders Category:Hibernian F.C. players Category:Gala Fairydean Rovers F.C. players Category:Filipino emigrants to Scotland Category:Competitors at the 2019 Southeast Asian Games
title: Yrick Gallantes
